message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG 

This paper deals with the problem of speaker naming in videos, which involves processing multiple modalities such as face and audio cues. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel convolutional neural network (CNN) based learning framework, which falls under the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also mentions the use of subtitles/transcripts, which suggests that it may be relevant to the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates its performance on two diverse TV series, indicating that it may be relevant to the Sound (cs.SD) sub-category.
